description:
Given two strings `s1` and `s2`, return `true` if `s2` contains a permutation of `s1`, or `false` otherwise.

In other words, return `true` if one of `s1`'s permutations is the substring of `s2`.

examples.explanation: s2 contains one permutation of s1 ("ba" at index 3).
No permutation of s1 ("ab" or "ba") appears as a contiguous substring of s2.

constraints: s1 and s2 consist of lowercase English letters.

testCases.explanation: "ba" at index 3 in s2 is a permutation of "ab".
No contiguous window in s2 contains a permutation of "ab".
s1 is longer than s2 — no permutation of s1 can fit in s2.
s2 is exactly s1 — the single character is its own permutation.
